descriptionHtml:
[center]﻿[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/65163-1-1430165203.png[/img]﻿[/center]

Hopefully a one-time upload. Repairing Armonizer, the long popular armor mix-up and compilation, for the modern Oldrim modder. Requires USLEEP.

Ketaroz compiled the original Armonizer project and put forth amazing work. Eventually his mods went cold, and Arahat took up the mantle of combining them into one place - with USLEEP and CCOR compatibility built in. But the file apparently doesn't work for the vast majority. One commentor, rad19dym, suggested a fix that I attempted, and it has so far worked where Arahat's native file has failed.

USLEEP is REQUIRED, as are the original "Armonizer Armors Pack", and the "Armonizer Armors Pack V3" for their files; you may leave their ESPs and ESMs deactivated EXCEPT FOR Ketaroz's Armonizer Armor Pack "Ket_Armonizer_V2.esm".

CCOR is not required, per my testing, it merely makes the necessary recipe / item adjustments to accommodate CCOR if not installed. If CCOR is not installed, no issues will arise, save perhaps some unintuitive recipes.

I wanted to use this for an incredibly heavily modded playthrough where every esp slot will be greatly necessary. Though, I ended up finding a more efficient option without using Armonizer, the fact that I was able to make this work - at least enough for my limited testing thus far - made me think that this should be shared with the greater community. I am sentimental towards the old mashup / compilation pack, and want people to experience it in their games for years yet. So, if this can help someone use the pack, then good.

This was done in a few minutes with TES5edit. I rewrote the error-causing records with the functioning ones in USLEEP. I made no other changes, and loaded no other files in the process. I am a long time mod-player, maker of small personal esps, and a student of computing; but I am by no means a proper scripter, programmer, or systems engineer. If I can help in some way in the future with this file, I hope I can. If this goes dormant in the meantime, I'm very sorry for the trouble.

[b]-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-[/b]

[b]INSTRUCTIONS:[/b]
[list]
[*]Ensure you have downloaded and correctly installed the Unofficial Skyrim Legendary Edition Patch (USLEEP)
[*]Download Armonizer Armors Pack, and install it either manually or through your mod manager of choice.
[*]Download Armonizer Armors Pack V3, and install it either manually or through your mod manager of choice.
[*]Deactivate their ESPs if they had been activated at any point, leave only the "Ket_Armonizer_V2.esm" activated.
[*]Download this mod (Armonizer Merged-Compatibilized-Repaired), and install it either manually or through your mod manager of choice.
[*]I would REALLY suggest a manual download, honestly. Just download the file, extract the esp from the archive, and drop it into your Skyrim Data folder.
[*]Activate this ESP in your load order.
[/list]
[b]-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--=-=-[/b][b]

[/b][b]COMPATIBILITY:[/b]
[list]
[*]Look at this clip: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DNeikvoqQ-s
[*]No, but really, I am not sure. I hope it works like Armonizer did. Even then, it might've had issues back then.
[*]Also, I haven't tested it very much yet. It's loaded the game, but I haven't strenuously tested every armor.
[*]You have been warned.
[/list]
[b]-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--=-=-[/b]


You can find [b]Arahat[/b]'s modpage here: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81642
You can find[b] Ketaroz[/b]'s first modpage (Armonizer Armors Pack) here: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81642
You can find [b]Ketaroz[/b]'s second modpage (Armonizer Armors Pack V3)  here: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39229
You can find [b]Rad19dym[/b]'s nexus profile here: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/21231444

[b]FrankDema[/b] (Nordic Conqueror Armor & Stormcloak Explorer Armor & Nordic Ranger Outfit)
[b]Jojjo[/b] (Frostmourne and Lich Kings Armor)
[b]mancika[/b] (Templar Set)
[b]Northborn[/b] (Fur Hoods HD)
[b]OmegaRed99[/b] (Omegared99 - Armor Compilation)
[b]Teh-Husky[/b]  (Morrowind Armor for Skyrim)

Given Arahat's modification of Ketaroz's work, I had assumed permission was given. If this is revealed to not be the case, I will remove this file. Similarly, I imagined that Arahat would respect his work being treated similarly, but if I am wrong, I will remove the file. Rad19dym shared his fix freely, I am merely publicizing it; if he would prefer me not to do so, I will remove the file.

You may do as you please, within bounds of the law, with these files. [b]You DO NOT need to credit me[/b], as I legitimately did not do anything but click seven times after opening up TES5Edit. Just the[b] actual authors[/b] (Ketaroz, Arahat, Rad19dym), and the[b] armor donators[/b] where appropriate.
